meanings.definition: To let saliva or liquid run from the mouth
meanings.sent1: The baby was slobbering while teething.
meanings.sent2: The dog was slobbering all over the floor.
meanings.sent3: The slobbering puppy left a trail of drool behind.
meanings.sent4: The leaky faucet was slobbering water non-stop.
meanings.sent5: The slobbering toddler made a mess at dinner time.

meanings.definition: To speak in a messy or uncontrolled way
meanings.sent1: The politician was slobbering during the debate.
meanings.sent2: The drunk man was slobbering his words at the bar.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's slobbering jokes had the audience laughing.
meanings.sent4: The teacher was slobbering instructions to the confused students.
meanings.sent5: The radio host was slobbering his speech on air.
